module.name: solid_with_local_modification
module.keywords: module, solid, edge, blend, chamfer, face, protrusion, depression, pattern, offset, deletion, modified.
module.purpose: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the modification of solids by making local changes to the shape. The types of modification permitted include edge based modifications, face based modifications and the introduction of depressions, protrusions of different shapes and regular patterns of these features.

inscope.li: solid models modified by the application of operations to their edges;
solid models with constant radius edge blends;
solid models with variable radius edge blends;
solid models modified by the creation of positioned and oriented local shape configurations (`features');
surfaces, faces and connected assemblies of faces;
solid models modified by the application of operations to their faces;
solid models modified by the removal of material from one side of an intersecting generalised surface;
solid models modified by adding material to, or subtracting material from, existing faces via offsets;
solid models modified by the deletion of some faces and the addition of material to the remaining faces;
solid models with circular or rectangular patterns made up of replicates of previously created depressions, protrusions or patterns;
solid models with circular or rectangular patterns in which some replicates have been suppressed;
items within the scope of application module Basic geometric topology, ISO/TS 10303-1323;
items within the scope of application module Procedural solid model, ISO/TS 10303-1318;
items within the scope of application module Topologically bounded surface, ISO/TS 10303-1511.

outscope.li: vertex blends including the specification of geometry generated where modified edges meet;
edge blends that are not of the rolling ball type;
the explicit identification of the face to be modified;
solid models created by thickening a single face;
modification of a solid model by re-defining the geometry associated with a face;
solid models with patterns of features that are not circular or rectangular patterns.

uof.name: Solid_with_local_modification
uof.description: The Solid_with_local_modification UoF specifies the data structure for the description of operations to modify locally the shape of solids. The types of modification supported include modification of the shape of one or more edges, identification of faces to be modified, the addition or subtraction of material to or from selected faces, the deletion of faces together with thickening of remaining faces and the cutting of solid models to create smaller solids, the modification of solids by introducing depressions, protrusions and patterns of features of these types in the vicinity of selected faces. It includes the specification of possible shapes of depressions and protrusions; the location of circular or rectangular patterns of such features and the suppression of selected elements from these patterns.
